title: Fire Prevention Week, 2025
summary: The document is a presidential proclamation declaring October 5 through October 11, 2025, as Fire Prevention Week. It emphasizes the importance of fire prevention and preparedness, highlighting recent wildfires in California that caused significant damage and loss of life due to poor management. The proclamation outlines recent executive actions to improve wildfire prevention and response, including the consolidation of wildland fire programs, the use of new technologies, and the establishment of a task force to assess disaster response capabilities. It also acknowledges the bravery of firefighters and first responders, noting permanent pay increases for federal wildland firefighters. The proclamation encourages all Americans to participate in fire prevention efforts and to take measures to protect their homes and communities from fire risks.
